0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Receive shipment manifests from importers to verify accuracy and completeness of data.
Verify commercial invoices against the Bill of Lading or other documentation to ensure conformity with customs regulations.
Satisfy export requirements by complying with applicable regulations, including obtaining necessary licenses and permits.
Determine compliance with laws, regulations, and international standards for imported goods.
Prepare documents, such as Commercial Invoices and Certificates of Origin, in accordance with applicable customs forms.
Verify and calculate duties, taxes, and other charges due on shipments.
Facilitate clearance of shipments by communicating with relevant authorities, including U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) or local customs agencies.
Filing documentation for the shipment, such as commercial invoices and bills of lading.
Notifying importers of delays in clearance of their shipments and providing updates on status.
Coordinating with shipping lines to resolve issues related to cargo that is undeliverable or not collectible
Scheduling appointments at post offices for mail or parcel pick up.
Resolving disputes between importers and shipping lines, including negotiating additional fees
Calculating duties and taxes due on shipments of high-value goods,
Filing information with the Customs Brokerage software in a timely manner.
Preparing and submitting documentation to support a claim for reimbursement of duties, taxes, or other charges that were assessed incorrectly.
Determining compliance with requirements imposed by international trade agreements such as NAFTA and TPP.
Handling sensitive information related to customs declarations and financial transactions according to company protocols.
Keeping records of communication with importers and other parties regarding shipments
Holding a phone conversation with shipping line to resolve issues, clarify any discrepancies in their reports
Responding promptly to inquiries from clients about the status of shipments, providing real-time updates.
Filing additional information with customs agency when required by applicable laws or regulations.
1: Design, develop, implement, and evaluate training programs for employees to enhance their skills and knowledge.
Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps and create customized training plans for departments or teams.
Recruit, train, and certify trainers to deliver high-quality training sessions.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to design and develop training content that meets business objectives.
Develop and manage training budgets, forecasts, and reports to ensure efficient use of resources.
Identify opportunities for employee development and implement strategies to increase skill levels and retention rates.
Create engaging and interactive training materials, such as videos, simulations, or gamification elements.
Provide coaching, mentoring, and feedback to employees during and after training sessions to support their learning journey.
Measure program effectiveness and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure training is meeting business objectives.
Develop and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders, including HR, management, and team leaders, to stay informed about training needs.
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in training and development, attending conferences, workshops, or webinars to expand knowledge and expertise.
2: Prepares a variety of food items for institutional or cafeteria customers, such as fruits, salads, and hot meals.
Plants ingredients according to standardized recipes in accordance with institutional food service standards.
Maintains proper sanitation and cleanliness during meal preparation and serving processes.
Responsible for managing inventory levels of perishable items within the food service area.
Maintains organized storage and shelving systems for supplies, equipment, and non-perishable food items.
Follows recipes and menus developed by a registered dietitian or head chef to provide nutritionally sound meals.
Ensures that all cooking surfaces, utensils, and equipment are cleaned, sanitized, and ready for use.
Reviews menu options and ingredients to ensure that dishes meet nutritional standards and accommodate special diets (e.g. vegetarian, gluten-free).
Prepares sauces and seasonings according to recipe requirements.
Participates in food safety practices such as proper handwashing and glove usage when handling raw meat or poultry.
Manages daily kitchen operations including managing cash register transactions for food sales.
Assists with the preparation of special events and banquets requiring large quantities of food.
